title: Colne Valley Trail Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Colne: Batchworth Lake weir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Colne: Batchworth Lake weir. Old Ordnance Survey maps show this as a public footpath crossing of the Colne. Modern health and safety considerations have however forced the closure of that opportunity and the footbridge is now firmly sealed with security railings. Batchworth Lake is visible beyond the river to the left.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Grand Union Canal in Rickmansworth, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Grand Union Canal in Rickmansworth

images.title: David Hawgood / Heron sculpture, Denham Country Park
images.caption: Heron sculpture, Denham Country Park. In the grounds of the Colne Valley Visitor Centre in Denham Country Park. The heron is the symbol of the Colne Valley Regional Park. The sculpture, unveiled in 2005, is six metres high.

images.title: Ray Stanton / Denham Country Park
images.caption: Denham Country Park. One of the lakes beside the Grand Union Canal

images.title: Nigel Cox / Rickmansworth: Footbridge over the River Colne
images.caption: Rickmansworth: Footbridge over the River Colne. The footbridge takes the Colne Valley Trail waymarked path out of Rickmansworth from Riverside Drive and over the River Colne.

images.title: Ray Stanton / Irrigation channel
images.caption: Irrigation channel. Bridge over Trout Road in distance.

images.title: Colne Valley Trail next to Old Slade Road by James Emmans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Next to Old Slade Road

images.title: David Kemp / Grand Union Canal near South Harefield
images.caption: Grand Union Canal near South Harefield. Taken from the London Loop/Colne Valley Trail footpath.

description: Follow the Colne Valley Trail from Uxbridge to Rickmansworth and enjoy riverside and canalside walking or cycling. The trails follows the Grand Union Canal and the River Colne while also passing a series of pretty Lakes including Lynsters, Stocker's and Batchworth Lake. The trail finishes at Batchworth Lake by the car park in Rickmansworth. You can continue your exercise on our Rickmansworth Walk This will take you around the lovely Rickmansworth Aquadrome where there's nature trails with lots of wildlife to look out for.
